title: Switching Between Erroneous Preferences Pages Generates Warning Instead of Error
description: When entering invalid data on any preference page and attempting to switch to another page without resolving the issue, a warning dialog is displayed. This report suggests that this warning should be an error dialog as users should not be allowed to leave the page without fixing the mistake.
OB: When I enter invalid data on any preference page and it triggers a validation warning on the UI, if I try to select another page without addressing the problem, I receive the following warning dialog: 'Warning: The currently displayed page contains invalid values.'
EB: When entering invalid data on any preference page and attempting to switch to another page without resolving the issue, an error dialog should be generated instead of a warning. The error dialog should clearly state that the user cannot leave the page without fixing the mistake.
SR:
To reproduce this issue:
1. Open the application and navigate to any preference page.
2. Enter invalid data that triggers a validation warning.
3. Attempt to switch to a different preference page without fixing the validation issue.
4. Observe that a warning dialog is displayed instead of an error dialog.
